result.execSummary:
The defendant Reginald Q Mountain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Reginald Q Mountain is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Reginald Q Mountain was found guilty of Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Reginald Q Mountain was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Reginald Q Mountain was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Reginald Q Mountain was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Renner.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  

Count 4 - deft fined $100 plus costs.  Bond from 15CF541 to be applied.  Balance to be returned to poster.

Remaining counts - deft sentenced to 58 days KCJ on each count concurrent.  Credit for 58 days.  Costs for each count rolled into sentence.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Renner.  Victim rights compliance.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty to counts 3,4,5, & 6; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  Sentencing set over to after the co-deft cases.  Sentencing set for 8/28/15 @ 10:15am

Deft was present earlier, but Atty Renner sent him home.  Plea hrg adj to 8/7/15 @ 10:30am.  Defense counsel has the responsibility of notifying her client of the new date/time.

No contact order continues as to Ronald G. & William M.  All other conditions remain in effect.

Jury selection on 6-22-15 @ 9:00am with co-defendants. Bond continued.
